This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.

prs.title: [solana] Update vest constraints and seeds
prs.truncated_body: This pull request addresses an issue in the vesting-related instructions (CreateVesting, CancelVesting, ClaimVesting and TransferVesting) where the vest account's validation and seeds were incorrectly tied to the vester_ta token account key directly. The previous implementation used has_one = vester_ta and included vester_ta.key() in the seeds, which was problematic because the owner of the vester

Fix CancelVesting. Add test for CancelVesting with changed token account owner
Update CancelVesting to use vester param
Update CreateVesting to use vester param
Update CreateVestingBalance to use vester param
Update CloseVestingBalance to use vester param
Update TransferVesting to use new_vester param
Change vester_ta constraints to token in ClaimVesting. Update vesting tests

prs.title: sdk: add StringToKnownChainID function for VAAs
prs.truncated_body:
Adds a function to the SDK's vaa structs that parses known ChainIDs from string representations of ints or chain names.

I've found myself wishing that this function exists in the context of working with ChainIDs. It's nice to have this parsing and validation provided by the SDK.

prs.title: [DX-267] Convert from Killgrave and Mockserver to Parrotserver
prs.truncated_body:
Marks previous mock adapter approaches of Killgrave and Mockserver as deprecated and uses Parrot instead for simplicity and compatibility. This has been tested on all of our Docker tests and with a wide range of K8s tests.

Trivially, this simplifies some code for us, and speeds things up a tiny bit. More crucially, it unlocks our ability to more deeply integrate with new, `ARM64` pipelines.

- Added a mechanism to incorporate Priority fees based off of a block history helped
 - Block History logic taken from TXM (reference: https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink-solana/blob/develop/pkg/solana/fees/block_history.go)
- Created a retry mechanism if it fails due to congestion

### Testing
Was able to confirm all the priority fees via Solana Explorer and logged

Added congestion check to start process with priority fees

prs.title: Use 'yarn test' in checks.yml
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

I was trying to find where we run tests on CI and couldn't find `yarn test`.
Then I realized we call `yarn jest` directly after setting `EA_PORT=0 METRICS_ENABLED=false`, but this is exactly what `yarn test` does.

So why not call `yarn test`?
For unit test we didn't set `EA_PORT=0` and with `yarn test` now we will, but I doubt this hurts anything.

## Changes

In `.githu

prs.title: Copy private data sources in batches
prs.truncated_body:
Currently, private data sources are copied one-by-one which can be very slow for deployments with huge numbers of data sources (say, 100's of thousands)

This PR changes that so that we copy data sources in bulk

commits.message: store: Refactor handling of manifest indexes for ds copying

store: Copy private data sources in batches

For large numbers of data sources, the existing RBAR behavior can be very
slow

store: Make ManifestIdxMap::new a little more efficient
store: Fix handling of bounds in DsForCopy::src_to_dst

prs.title: devnet-sdk/op-acceptance-tests: introduce `RequireNoChainFork` and use in `withdrawal_root_test.go`
prs.truncated_body:
This introduces a helper which can be invoked in one line in any acceptance test. It checks all clients agree on the block hash when called, and then checks again when the test is done (also requiring the chain progressed). 

These are very basic sanity checks which are good to add to essentially any test to give us convenient cross-client consensus checks. 

Unfortunately I haven't been able

commits.message: start looping in multiclient to withdrawalsRootTestScenario

prs.title: op-service: increase fuzz coverage
prs.truncated_body:
Closes #15053 

* Increases fuzzing time by a factor of 6
* Overall CI runtime unaffected. The particular job takes about twice as long now, but that is a good ROI and makes it shorter than other jobs which run concurrently
* Ensures all fuzz tests in the `eth` directory are detected and triggered
* This exposed an actual test failure for a test which wasn't being run in CI  https://github.co

commits.message:
find and run all Fuzz* tests in op-service/eth directory

This also causes the tests to be prebuilt, so each parallel job doesn't need to build the tests again

expected error when trying to verify bad result with good root: key=30 value=

when fuzzing...
do no fail test if verification succeeds but storage value is zero

prs.title: firedancer: exec model changes pt1
prs.truncated_body:
This pr shifts transaction execution out of a tpool into exec tiles. Also is responsible for managing concurrency management around the tiles. 

This pr also changes hashing logic to support lists of accounts to support hashing in exec tiles as well.

All items for follow up:
1. exec tiles for epoch boundary
2. exec tiles for hashing
3. exec tiles for bpf cache
4. change replay_exec links

commits.message: runtime: transaction execution in exec tiles

prs.title: program updates
prs.truncated_body:
Changes:
- Add a secondary relayer for 0-downtime transitions between relayers
- Relax ata constraints on fee receivers: Only check their existence if the fees are positive
- Add a new instruction where swap fee bps is determined by the input

Tests to add:
- Assert second relayer works
- Test custom fees
- Test not checking atas when fees are 0

Next steps:
- Deploy program
- Acceptin

prs.title: fix(fortuna): fix too high fees
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Reject setting the fees too high

## Rationale

We estimate priority fees similar to how ethers.rs library does it. This is the general algo:
1- Get the priority fees of the last 10 blocks
2- Sort them
3- Get the median OR if there is any sudden increase, take the median from that index forward  (https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/blob/master/ethers-core/src/utils/mod.rs#L59

prs.title: Switch to post-rust-1.84 wasm target wasm32v1-none
prs.truncated_body:
Part of wrapping up bug https://github.com/stellar/rs-soroban-sdk/issues/1428. Mostly this is just:

- Switching rust version to 1.84 which supports `wasm32v1-none`
- Switching the SDK to build with that, not `wasm32-unknown-unknown`

But there are a couple minor subtle bits:

- Some of the crates only build native, not wasm, and we weren't differentiating that in the Makefile right
- Ther

prs.title: Update invoke example values for numeric and byte types
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Update example values for numeric and byte types that are presented to users in docs about a contract on the invoke command. 

### Why
The examples provided were a mix of rather random values, such as 'beefface123' for bytes, and some integers were exampled as '42', others contained negative signs which looked a bit confusing when seeing a suggestion to use a negative value for values

prs.title: Bump XDR/p23 env to pick up CAP-67 changes.
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Bump XDR/p23 env to pick up CAP-67 changes.

Besides the bump, this adds some e2e coverage for the SAC and address changes (ensure the new address types aren't valid in p22, ensure that muxed account SAC transfers work e2e and that CB/LP addresses are not supported).


# Checklist
- [ ] Reviewed the [contributing](https://github.com/stellar/stellar-core/blob/master/CONTRIBUT

commits.message:
Bump XDR/p23 env to pick up CAP-67 changes.

Besides the bump, this adds some e2e coverage for the SAC and address changes (ensure the new address types aren't valid in p22, ensure that muxed account SAC transfers work e2e and that CB/LP addresses are not supported).

prs.title: Fixed loadgen bug for soroban upgrades
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Fixes issue in loadgen, where Soroban upgrades would always be invalid. This also introduces a minor change to the loadgen upgrade interface. Previously, a config setting was not upgrade if the upgrade query string omitted the field or had a value of 0. This changes the interface such that the field is not upgraded when it is omitted. A value of 0 means the config parameter will b

commits.message: Fixed loadgen bug for soroban upgrades

prs.title: fix(17180): EventCreator ignores HealthMonitor update when squelching enabled
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

When squelched, the EventCreator, if previously registered an unhealthy status by the health monitor, ignores the message that informs it that things are now in a healthy state again. Thus, it fails to start creating events again, given that the monitor doesn't repeat reports if they are unchanged.

 After this change, the monitor tracks the transitions to healthy and reports

prs.title: Update the sealed-secret for the redeployed integration-docker env
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
DevOps refreshed and redeployed the `integration-docker` preprod env using an updated Terraform deployment.
The new environment has replaced the old, however there have been a few backend changes such as new streams and backups bucket names, new read-only GCP SA and AWS IAM User (along with new keys for both), the creation of a S3 bucket that was missing for this environment, an

commits.message:
Update the sealed-secret for the redeployed integration-docker env

Signed-off-by: Nir Ben-Or <nir@swirldslabs.com>

prs.title: Improve modularized metrics and dashboard
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

* Add a `hedera_mirror_web3_evm_invocation_total` counter to track EVM rps with status
* Add EVM execution rate graphs broken down by status to Grafana dashboard
* Add gas limit graph to Grafana dashboard
* Add modularized traffic percent pie chart and graph to Grafana
* Add `modularized` tag to gas used metric
* Fix some non-zero realm issues in `TransactionExecutorServic

commits.message:
Add status label to gas consumed metric

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@swirldslabs.com>

prs.title: Adapt web3 k6 estimate tests to work with environment variables
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
This PR adapts the web3 k6 estimate tests to work with environment variables. This is needed for convenience when we need to make the performance testing. The test environment variables are updated and ready to be used against the mainnet snapshot DB. _At this point they will not work directly against mainnet (valid for the estimate and the modification tests)._

2 more tests n

commits.message:
Adapt web3 k6 tests to work with environment variables and mainnet snapshot

Signed-off-by: Bilyana Gospodinova <bilyana.gospodinova14@gmail.com>

More test setup fixes

Signed-off-by: Bilyana Gospodinova <bilyana.gospodinova14@gmail.com>

Add documentation for the new vars and remove default gas parameter

Signed-off-by: Bilyana Gospodinova <bilyana.gospodinova14@gmail.com>
